title: Karel Martens to speak at St Bride Conference (Update)
content:
Submitted by [Miss Tiffany](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173928/http:/www.typophile.com/user/108 "View user profile.") : 12.May.2008 1.12pm 

Seeking Inspiration: creative thinking around the design process  
================================================================  
Seventh annual St Bride Library conference  
15-16 May 2008  
At St Bride Library, Bride Lane, Fleet St, London EC4Y 8EE

The greatly respected Dutch book designer Karel Martens will be speaking  
at this year’s conference.

Karel Martens: An error occurred  
————————————————

Karel will start by showing three (very) short films: ‘notforresale’, ‘lost  
and found’, ‘homage to the alphabet’. This will lead on to a  
conversation between Karel and Robin Kinross, with unpredictable results.

Karel Martens is a graphic designer, specializing in typography. He has  
won numerous awards – a 1996 prize resulting in the publication of a  
monograph of his work Printed matter. He has taught graphic design for  
over thirty years and is a much-revered mentor of Dutch Graphic Design  
inspiring younger generations towards an approach to design which  
prioritises intelligence and integrity. He is a co-founder of the  
Werkplaats Typografie in Arnhem, a two-year workshop education which he  
now oversees with fellow designer Armand Mevis.

Robin Kinross is a typographer and editor. He runs Hyphen Press, whose  
authors include Christopher Burke, Fred Smeijers, Gerrit Noordzij, Jost  
Hochuli, and David Wild. He has collaborated as writer and publisher  
with Karel Martens on the books Printed matter and Counterprint. A third  
edition of Printed matter is in preparation now.
